The Degtyaryov machine gun, also known as the DP-27, is chambered in 7.62×54mmR and was designed to be a light, belt-fed machine gun capable of providing sustained fire support. It was widely used during World War II by the Soviet Union and remained in service for many years. The DP-27 was known for its distinctive top-mounted, pan-style magazine and reliable performance, even in harsh conditions, making it a key weapon for Soviet infantry forces during the war.

facts: This gun is a bolt-action rifle that was developed in the 1890s by the Danish inventor Ole Krag and the Norwegian military. The Krag–Jørgensen was the standard infantry rifle of both Denmark and Norway and later saw use in several other countries. It was chambered in 6.5×55mm Swedish or 7.62×54mm for some variants. The rifle is known for its smooth, rear-locking bolt mechanism and internal magazine, which allowed for faster reloading compared to earlier designs. The Krag–Jørgensen was notably used by Norwegian forces during World War II and was highly regarded for its accuracy and reliability.
